name: Book discussion of Aishwarya Jha's latest THE SCENT OF FALLEN STARS with Deepthi Talwar | 28 JULY, 6 PM
description: Join Aishwarya Jha and Deepti Talwar as they discuss THE SCENT OF FALLEN STARS, Aishwarya's latest book about a  scholarly loner and a musical prodigy  who came to India for  answers, over twenty years apart.  About the speakers: Aishwarya Jha is a writer, designer and entrepreneur from New Delhi. A mentee at the Asian Women Writers programme, her poetry, short fiction and essays have been published in numerous literary journals and an anthology at Oxford University. Deepthi Talwar is the executive editor at @penguinrandomhouseindia  About the book: A scholarly loner and a musical prodigy come to India for answers, over twenty years apart… In 1995, thirty-six-year-old Will arrives in newly liberalized India. Smarting from the collapse of his academic dreams, he finds little fulfilment in his well-paying telecommunications job or the social confines of New Delhi’s expat community. One monsoon night, he encounters young, enigmatic Leela, who blazes into his world and unleashes a storm of passion and devastation that will alter it forever. Twenty-three years later, Aria lands in the city on a quest to find the mother whom she believed to be dead. Estranged from her convalescing father, her journey leads her to unravel the mysteries of her parents’ story and her mother’s life—from her childhood in an orphanage to a doomed love affair and finally, the remote shores of asceticism. As she searches for answers and a sense of belonging, Aria stumbles upon lost worlds, haunting memories, and the explosive secret that torpedoed her father’s life, the reverberations of which will be cataclysmic for her own. You can  RSVP  here.  The details of the event are as follows:  Date and time: 28 July, 6 PM  Venue: Champaca Bookstore

name: Journalling For Self Expression: Workshop with Shruti Parthasarathy | 14 July, 11 AM
description:
Join us for a workshop on journalling for self expression. The workshop will be led by Shruti Parthasarathy. Here are some details about the event:  What is JOURNALLING? - Journaling is a form of self -expression, like dancing, singing, sketching etc. - Journaling can be an individual and group activity. - There are various types of journaling - Prompt Based Journaling, Bullet journaling, Sprint Journaling, Diary entry, Letter writing, Doodle Journaling etc. - You can journal on a daily, weekly, monthly, yearly basis or whenever you feel like. During the session we will work on *PROMPT* based *JOURNALLING*. - On the day of the session, you will be given a bunch of prompts to choose from. (A prompt can be a quote, text, visual, audio cue, a question etc, that pushes you to think in a certain direction) - You will have to pick one, and write wherever that prompt takes you. - You can write how ever little or much you would like to.   We shall also discuss the benefits of journaling & how to maintain a journal. How does this help? - To provide healthy outlets of emotional expression - To develop a habit of writing/journaling - To tap into your creative side - Let’s you recenter and/or set goals If you are a novice and have always thought about writing or maintaining a journal, then this workshop is a great place to start. 
 This workshop is for you if you : 1.⁠ ⁠Have always wanted to try journaling, but couldn't get into the habit. 2.⁠ ⁠Have wondered about journaling 3.⁠ ⁠Have been overwhelmed with everything happening around you 4.⁠ ⁠Find it hard to manage your emotions and the little things 5.⁠ ⁠Enjoy writing, listening or being part of communities 
 What you need: If you are old school : A journal and/or pen/pencil If you like to go digital : Your phone/tablet/laptop and your fingers What this workshop is NOT : - This workshop is not about good grammar, or English, or about testing your skills as a writer. - It is not therapy, but it can be therapeutic. Other Details: When - 14th July, 11 AM Where - Champaca, Bangalore You can RSVP here. About the Host : Shruti  Parthasarathy is a writer, photographer, filmmaker and avid journaller. She is an alumni of Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute. She has conducted creative writing, photography, and journaling workshops and been associated with companies like IBM, Bosch, Schlumberger, Bajaj Auto, Harness and Aruba to name a few. She believes that everything one does is a reflection of the people, place and time one lives in. Journaling has helped her grow as an individual and as a writer. The heaps of journals she has written on is a testament to that!
